DOC.HEAD: London Stocks Move Higher
DOC.TEXT: Stock prices closed higher in moderate trading Wednesday, as the market reacted with enthusiasm to Wall Street's recovery from its Tuesday lows. Selective buying, the re-emergence of takeover speculation in the composite insurance sector, and the continuation of a stock shortage also helped the market, dealers said. Still, the market was lethargic despite good volume, dealers said. ``People are conscious of the strengths of the market, but many are still happy to sit on the sidelines,'' said one dealer, adding that business was winding down ahead of the approaching holidays. The Financial Times-Stock Exchange 100-stock index closed 18.6 points, or 0.8 percent, higher at 2,360.7. The Financial Times 30-share index was up 13.5 points at 1,866.0 at the close. The Financial Times 500-share index rose 7.53 points to close at 1,280.69. Volume amounted to a healthy 552.9 million shares compared with 589.2 million shares Tuesday.
